newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil court issues new CVRD injunction.
newsitem.headline: Brazil court issues new CVRD injunction.

text.p: A Rio de Janeiro judge issued an injunction against the privatisation auction of Brazilian state mining giant Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (CVRD) before the sale was completed, a court spokeswoman said.
In the injunction, the judge said that should the auction have already taken place, the transfer of shares to the winner would be halted, she added.
National Development Bank privatisation director Jose Pio Borges told reporters after hearing that the court had issued various injunctions before and they had all been revoked later.
In the auction, the Valepar consortium led by steelmaker CSN bought 41.73 percent out of a possible 45 percent voting shares put up for auction by the government.
The consortium paid 3.338 billion reais, an official of the Rio de Janeiro bolsa said.
The court official said that should the National Development Bank so wish, it could appeal against the injunction which, she added, was issued at 1745 GMT/2045 GMT.
